intro: Anacampta submollis, commonly known as the softleaf anacampta, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
